file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-50-34-06 - FLAP ALTITUDE EXCEEDANCE - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLAP ALTITUDE EXCEEDANCE - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the necessary actions that must be taken after the aircraft has flown at an altitude more than the altitude for flaps actuation. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FLAP ALTITUDE EXCEEDANCE - IN- ALL 05-50-34-200-801-A SPECTION/CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-50-34 Page 1 of 2 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-50-34-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FLAP ALTITUDE EXCEEDANCE - INSPECTION/CHECK A. General (1) This section gives the necessary actions to do after the aircraft has flown at an altitude that is more than the altitude for flaps actuation. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 05-50-07/600 - INSPECTION/CHECK C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended Not Applicable I. Flap-Extended Altitude Exceedance - Event Assessment SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) The necessary actions to do when the altitude goes beyond the altitude for flaps extension are given bellow: 1. If the envelope altitude goes beyond but the speed envelope does not and based on the operational limits listed in the AOM, no further actions are necessary. 2. If the altitude and speed goes beyond, do the AMM MPP 05-50-07/600. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-50-34 Page 2 of 2 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
